channel.title: How to use Moparscape servers
channel.description:
I've searched all over the furoms and i would like to know how to use someones server. I do not want i guide on making one (there are plenty of those) I just want to know how to use one that has been set up. I downloaded all their stuff and unzipped it, but i have no idea how to use it. Right now all i have is a bunch of computer data and no game . So could someone please direct to a tutorial or just explain on this thread how to use servers. (you'll have to be patience i'm completly new to this kind of thing)
I believe this place is the place to post this question (i posted in the wrong place twice before :()
Also, would anyone tell my how to find out what kind of router i have?

item.title: How to use Moparscape servers
item.dc:creator: @The_rogue_user The rogue user
item.description:
@The_rogue_user wrote:

moparisthebest.com

moparisthebest.com

programming, irc, cars

That is the server i downloaded. The person said i needed to portforward everything, but i do not know what or to where.

Thanks for the website btw :).[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 17, 2008, 06:59:53 pm[/size][hr]Now i’ve downloaded 10 different servers and one of them worker (and it wasn’t a good one). I do not know what i’m doing wrong, could someone just brief me on the steps i have to take. Most of them have two differnet downloads which is really confusing because i do not know what i have to do with them when they are seperate. When i click the run server thing in the file it just opens a black box that says Run (name of server) online! Then nothing else happens. I have no clue what to do to get a game going.

Read full topic

item.description:

portforward.com -all tutorials + definitions
There.

item.title: How to use Moparscape servers
item.dc:creator: @si_force Si Force
item.description:
@si_force wrote:

download jdk + java , download a client,
Double click run.bat and login with
The ip set to “localhost”.

Read full topic
